intro: Rudgea fimbriata, commonly known as the fringeleaf corymbia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive fringed leaves and showy red or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It is often found in regions of New South Wales and Queensland. Rudgea fimbriata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
